q: What is the difference between GET and POST methods in http?
th: GET and POST http methods are actually the same, but there is an agreement that POST can have a body and can modify server state.
+: POST can modify a server state
GET is expected to be idempotent
-: GET can modify a server state
POST is expected to be idempotent
POST always returns None while GET returns what was requested
GET is used to get items while POST is used to post items
They are text strings in http protocol with meaning up to a developer who implements the app logic

q: Which of these are 'success' response codes?
th: 2xx...3xx response codes are considered to be an operation success.

q: What http request is not idempotent?
th: It's an industry agreement between developers that 'POST' can change server state, while other verbs should not. It's not strictly held, to be honest.

q: What port is intended for http requests?
th: Port 80 is the port number assigned to commonly used internet communication protocol, Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP). It is the port from which a computer sends and receives Web client-based communication and messages from a Web server and is used to send and receive HTML pages or data.
-: no dedicated port, it depends on the app

q: What port is intended for https requests?
th: Port 443 is intended for Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) requests. HTTPS is an extension of http. It is used for secure communication over a computer network. In HTTPS, the communication protocol is encrypted using Transport Layer Security (TLS) or, formerly, Secure Sockets Layer (SSL).
-: no dedicated port, it depends on the app

q: What does letter 'S' stand for in 'HTTPS'?
th: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS). 'S' means 'Secure'.

q: ... is an http status code ('Not Found').
th: 404 is an http status code ('Not Found').

q: ... is an http status code ('Bad Request').
th: 400 is an http status code ('Bad Request').

q: What http status code means that the user is authorized, but does not have access to all parts of the application?
th: 403 http status code means that the user is authorized, but does not have access to all parts of the application.

q: What http status code means that the user is not authenticated?
th: 401 http status code means that the user is not authenticated.

q: What http status code means that the payment is required?
th: 402 http status code means that the payment is required.

q: What http status code means that the method is not allowed?
th: 405 http status code means that the method is not allowed.

q: What http status code means 'Unprocessable Entity'?
th: 422 http status code means 'Unprocessable Entity'.

q: What is a standard response for successful http requests?
th: 200 OK is a standard response for successful http requests.

q: What http response code tells that the request has been fulfilled, resulting in the creation of a new resource?
th: '201 Created' http response code tells that the request has been fulfilled, resulting in the creation of a new resource.

q: What http response code tells that the server successfully processed the request, and is not returning any content?
th: '204 No Content' http response code tells that the server successfully processed the request, and is not returning any content.

q: What http response code tells that this and all future requests should be directed to another URI?
th: '301 Moved Permanently' http response code tells that this and all future requests should be directed to another URI.

q: What is the generic http response code telling that something has gone wrong on the web site's server?
th: '500 Internal Server Error' http response code tells that something has gone wrong on the web site's server.

q: What http response code tells that the server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfil the request?
th: '501 Not Implemented' is the http response code telling that the server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfil the request.

q: What http response code tells that the server cannot handle the request (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance)?
th: '503 Service Unavailable' is the http response code telling that the server cannot handle the request (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance).

q: What parts does an http request consist of?
th: An http request consists of three parts: request line, headers, message body (optional). Request line consists of a verb, path, http version. Host is an obligatory header. If there is content-length in headers, you should expect a body.

q: What parts does a request line of an http request consist of?
th: An http request consists of three parts: request line, headers, message body (optional). Request line consists of a verb, path, http version. Host is an obligatory header. If there is content-length in headers, you should expect a body.

q: What obligatory header does every http request have?
th: An http request consists of three parts: request line, headers, message body (optional). Request line consists of a verb, path, http version. Host is an obligatory header. If there is content-length in headers, you should expect a body.

q: What is optional in http requests?
th: An http request consists of three parts: request line, headers, message body (optional). Request line consists of a verb, path, http version. Host is an obligatory header. If there is content-length in headers, you should expect a body.

q: Choose one of the principal authors of the HTTP protocol.
th: Roy Thomas Fielding is an American computer scientist, one of the principal authors of the HTTP specification and the originator of the Representational State Transfer architectural style.

q: How many logical parts maximum may an http request consist of?
th: An http request consists of three parts: request line, headers, message body (optional). Request line consists of a verb, path, http version. Host is an obligatory header. If there is content-length in headers, you should expect a body.
